00040 #ifndef _crossplatform_cpp
00041 #define _crossplatform_cpp
00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 //this is the place where ALL of the non-multiplatform code goes.
00044 
00045 //Internal includes
00046 #include "crossplatform.h"
00047 #include "world.h"
00048 
00049 //External includes
00050 #include <Ogre.h>
00051 #include "SDL.h"
00052 
00053 //Selective Includes
00054 #ifdef WINDOWS
00055         #include <cstdlib>//for sleep
00056         #include "SDL_syswm.h" //for the needed commands
00057 #else
00058         #include <unistd.h>//for sleep
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 namespace phys
00062 {
00063     namespace crossplatform
00064     {
00065         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00066         //returns: The appropriate string, which contains a path, to the correct
00067         //"plugins.cfg" file
00068         string GetPluginsDotCFG()
00069         {
00070             #ifdef LINUX
00071                 return "data/linux/plugins.cfg";
00072             #endif
00073             #ifdef WINDOWS
00074                 return "data/windows/plugins.cfg";
00075             #endif
00076 
00077         }
00078 
00079         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00080         //returns: The appropriate string, which contains a path, to the correct
00081         //"settings.cfg" file
00082         string GetSettingsDotCFG()
00083         {
00084             #ifdef LINUX
00085                 return "data/linux/settings.cfg";
00086             #endif
00087             #ifdef WINDOWS
00088                 return "data/windows/settings.cfg";
00089             #endif
00090         }
00091 
00092         string GetDataDirectory()
00093         {
00094             return "data/common/";
00095         }
00096 
00097         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00098         //This returns a named parameter list with valid settings to use Ogre rendering
00099         //on a pre-existing SDL context
00100         //void* is always an ogre NameValuePairList
00101         void* GetSDLOgreBinder()
00102         {
00103             Ogre::NameValuePairList *misc = new Ogre::NameValuePairList();
00104             #ifdef WINDOWS
00105                 SDL_SysWMinfo wmInfo;
00106                 SDL_VERSION(&wmInfo.version);
00107                 SDL_GetWMInfo(&wmInfo);
00108 
00109                 size_t winHandle = reinterpret_cast<size_t>(wmInfo.window);
00110                 size_t winGlContext = reinterpret_cast<size_t>(wmInfo.hglrc);
00111 
00112                 (*misc)["externalWindowHandle"] = Ogre::StringConverter::toString(winHandle);
00113                 (*misc)["externalGLContext"] = Ogre::StringConverter::toString(winGlContext);
00114                 (*misc)["externalGLControl"] = Ogre::String("True");
00115             #else
00116                 (*misc)["currentGLContext"] = Ogre::String("True");
00117             #endif
00118 
00119             return misc;
00120         }
00121 
00122         void WaitMilliseconds(const Whole &WaitTime)
00123         {
00124             #ifdef WINDOWS
00125                 Sleep(WaitTime);
00126             #else
00127                 usleep(1000*WaitTime);
00128             #endif
00129         }
00130 
00131         void RenderPhysWorld(World *TheWorld)
00132         {
00133             #ifndef WINDOWS
00134                TheWorld->OgreGameWindow->update(true);
00135             #else
00136                TheWorld->OgreRoot->renderOneFrame();
00137                SDL_GL_SwapBuffers();
00138             #endif
00139         }
00140 
00141     }
00142 }
00143 
00144 #endif
